column1: Table 11. Unadjusted violent victimization rate, by victim’s sex and disability type, 2009–2012
Report title: Crime Against Persons with Disabilities, 2009-2012-Statistical Tables
Data source: BJS National Crime Victimization Survey and U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey
Table 11. Unadjusted violent victimization rate, by victim’s sex and disability type, 2009–2012

Note: Based on noninstitutionalized U.S. residential population age 12 or older. Estimates were based on 2-year rolling averages. Includes persons with multiple disability types. Age-adjusted rates were not generated by disability type due to data differences and limitations for males and females. Rates are per 1,000 persons age 12 and older, except for independent living disability, which is per 1,000 persons age 15 or older. See Methodology. See appendix table 11 for standard errors.
Sources: Bureau of Justice Statistics, National Crime Victimization Survey, 2008–2012; and U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 2008–2012.
